lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before we jump into tonight's episode, we have some announcements to get through beginning with the first of our two sponsors, Ravensburger, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think that's how you say that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To celebrate their new game, Ravensburger, maybe, sent me Wonder Woman's actual golden Lariat of Truth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Phew, I'm so glad it didn't work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ashley Marsupial Bernadette Russell Crowe Von Chex Mix W Johnson the 24th.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Ashley, tell me about the new Wonder Woman game.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Where are you strategize, face foes, and rise to meet the challenge of the Amazons together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who would you rather kiss? Who would you rather marry? And who would you rather kill?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kiss Laura Bailey, marry Brian W. Foster, kill Sam Riegel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kiss, Marry, Kill: Marisha, Liam, and Taliesin in this time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kill Sam Riegel, drive the body to the Brown Mountain Dam in the Angeles Forest, dump it in the creek behind the dam because no one ever looks there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you Sam and thank you, Ravensburger--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second sponsor tonight, our returning friends since the beginning of this campaign at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get it now for Android or Apple and check out more at dndbeyond.link/CRapp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My hat's off to you, D&D Beyond, that was an excellent trolling of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe, oh! I believe those are all the announcements we have tonight.

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: That's the tower you're at now, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No allies to help. We don't need 'em!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tried to empathize with ghosts before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The only thing we haven't done is checked out the Winding Core.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are we going to get?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a mine that we haven't checked out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is, in its own way a sliver, but with the Underdark."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But pissed off things from the Underdark that might be mad that it got drug.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But you also haven't been yourself for 25 years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But there are beings down there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are all sorts of horrible things down there."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe they're looking to get even.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So this-- explain the-- how this looks-- it looks familiar to the architecture that was, like, around...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like around in the Barbed Fields area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's similar to those, though not quite.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like where all those shards were?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are just-- it was just ruins and buildings from what was once the central city of the Betrayer Gods during the Calamity, that was then destroyed and left to ruin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was an ice cream scoop of another dimension.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, we don't need to go shopping in the place with all the terrible creatures.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that the terrible creatures will be much harder to reason with than sentient beings here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like no one said that until you did just now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just saying we shouldn't be--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, so once again, bringing up a point that no one said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The thing that we just met and could have allied ourself with: We killed it in 18 seconds!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And no one else said anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I said, I could and he said, "How?" And then we attacked them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, anyway, not a big deal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, everyone seems to be making it a big deal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's not a big deal, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The DM just made it a big deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was clarifying because there was some confusion as to what may have transpired here and I didn't want to talk in circles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're talking about it so much because it's so not a big deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- but we can clean the sheets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Veth makes a really good point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like, we got a free ally with Vilya.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like you're just as upset and you're trying to make it better.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay? Sometimes you kill a horse that you did not need to kill.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What horse? What horse did we kill?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not that there needed to be a lesson! There's no lesson!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no lesson to be learned!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing learned! Tomorrow we kill Vokodo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're probably safe to camp here, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to get part way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemed to act like the first punch stopped a possible conversation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any of you had a chance to have any sort of interaction with these things to that battle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, by that point, our friends were possessed pretty fast and, you know, they were attacking us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just want to say, our track record with ghosts hasn't been great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's not totally true, Beau, because I did read porn to some and they liked it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's rare you find horny ghosts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I don't think Caduceus was with us at that point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or do we head back to the beach?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus was with you guys when you did that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may have just tried not to pay attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we actually weighing sleeping in a dome out here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's nothing here to hurt us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think maybe on the top floor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, the top floor is very teeny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't think that the little specter that was in the sarcophagus is going to, like, gain power by resting and then come up through the floor and (choking) in the middle of the night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But then back that way are those walking bloody tree things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think we can ally with the bloody trees?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we could throw the dome up there so that the trees--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we talk to the walking talking-- they lost their minds, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just want to make it right, guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We-- we-- we all didn't make the right decisions here, maybe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not like you offered to restart a war between two nations.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter) That would be crazy! Who would do such a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can try making our way back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- it's about 3:30, four o'clock in the afternoon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, so let's take time to start making our way so there's less to travel tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And, honestly, the less spells we have to expend getting back to the beach tomorrow, the more we can do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Honestly, we either camp here, which we don't need to do, or we just try to sneak back several hours on foot and park it in the jungle somewhere.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's nothing else to see around here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (creature hissing) Slayer's Cake somewhere around here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The same path? The direction you were previously traveling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys going stealthily from that point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, everyone make a group stealth check for me, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No Pass Without a Trace, I'm assuming?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't even hear you, you're so stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To a total of-- what's the total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Veth and Beauregard, both equally vanishing into another campaign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just fart right in her path.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could, if you wanted to, continue and get more distance across the mountainside, into the evening, you're welcome to, or you could stop now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would we make it all the way back to the boats? Probably not, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four hours of travel across the mountain range will get you a fair distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we sleep here and we fly in the morning, is it going to be just an hour of flight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you continue on for the mountain for a bit, you may be able to cut one hour off of that flight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It seems worth it, s Save a spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not a lot of them, but I have a couple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And plus, are we going back to where the ships are, to the rear entrance? Are we going to try and go and turn Terra as well and add one to our number? Before we fight Vokodo?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have any Greater Restoration left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you couldn't get to Vo tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vo is on the opposite side of the mountain from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We couldn't get to Vo tonight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have one left if we had to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many of those fancy bowls you got for Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could we have Terra meet us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She is not supposed to go? Would she do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She could come close, maybe? Just to the edge of something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vilya could maybe-- could you snag her? And fly her to us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We might have to lie to her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey Terra, Vilya needs your help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then-- just to game this out-- would lying to Terra to get her to come to a place where she's not supposed to be when she gets there, we're like, "Haha! We lied! But seriously, we need your help." Right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no. We'll-- Vilya would go up and be like, "I'm still Viridian," and then she would shake her hand and be like, "I'm so glad you came, I need your help." But she would cast Greater Restoration when she shook her hand and Terra will be totally free of it and she will help us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it was one thing to get you to sit still I don't know if--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't say that I'm a great liar, but I can try?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does she ever move alone as a hunting leader? Or does she usually travel with a troop?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And if you are talking about sending a message, we need to word that one very carefully so that she doesn't come with a whole party.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not worth the risk just to get one. I dunno how we would get just her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's got to be one, otherwise it's a negative, not a positive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we get her that we kill all of her friends and then we turn her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not, maybe without Terra, then? And if so, are we taking that second entrance into Vokodo's lair? It's still pulled us towards, I'm assuming, it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but maybe from a different direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it'll go above him or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No one can do that-- you can't do that, can you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't believe I can, my apologies."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can't make the ground shake or anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You made a leg out of vines.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Scales up a bit for what you're asking."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So no Terra, we just go in lean and mean? Is that what we're saying?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The influence is deeper down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Its lair might be trapped and protected.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could send it a message when we got close, maybe? Talk some shit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vilya, do you know any reason why Vokodo would have a reason to come out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've never, ever seen him emerge from his lair."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it were really angered, who knows if that thing would blow or not? Is Vo directly beneath, down below?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would not want to put them "in harm's way."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think fighting Vokodo would activate a volcano that would endanger them on the outside if we were fighting underneath?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "not if you were to finish the job."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we just need to pick our place to camp and prepare ourselves the best we can and do what we do best: improvise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just throwing it out there, we could go in from both directions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be nice to have more people, of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'd be nice to know where that second entrance actually goes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And if there are all those weaving tunnels, where do those go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, not all of them connect to the main chamber, there's no way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's almost no way to explore it, though, without one of us being like, "uhh," and going towards the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless you want to (popping) and we're out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could also tie a line just as an early warning if someone starts to go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you were tethered and you were in that state you were in, do you think you would cut that rope?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we weren't going the way I wanted to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We take all of our weapons away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I honestly don't have anything to cut it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would give us an opportunity to see that someone was trying to leave, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bind all of our hands and teeth so we can't cut or bite anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And yet I still have no idea how to fight it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We know none of his weaknesses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't exactly know what he is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We know that if we shift him into another dimension, we could possibly hold them there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We know he's greedy and we know he's afraid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So if someone wanted to go through the front door with an offering that could maybe distract it while the others go through the back door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't know how long that back door is going to take, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could send messages to each other when we're in place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I think it all does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's the only one that would remember how to navigate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or Frumpkin, but only to a distance, right? To explore those tunnels.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean the front door tunnels? He could draw a map.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- Frumpkin could go through, but I'm unaware if Vokodo's mojo would work on a fey creature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A map's not a bad idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just don't think we should split the party.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It seems weird to be given a second entrance, though, and not utilize it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I think we should just go in the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It might not work, but it is definitely worth the effort.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we still walking, or are we camping right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are deciding whether or not you're taking the mountain pass or camping here at the base of the volcano.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Walk and talk. We're walk and talking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Along the journey here, but you're deciding that stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Has anyone else ever given an offering to Vokodo with you from the village?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because the path is too dangerous "for me to travel with more than just myself."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So Terra doesn't know how to get there, no one else knows how to get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Terra was here before I was, but--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did they do the offerings without you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They had the previous spiritual guardian "that would go ahead and make the offerings "before they passed away."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, they just died of old age or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They never came back from their trip."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he didn't like the offering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Those vines that I warned you about?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So Vilya could go in the front door with an offering.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vilya would still be susceptible to the pull, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the pull wears off once you're there, correct?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we still have the same feeling of being watched right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you take a moment to pull back and just look for that sensation, indeed, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, I can be down with that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vilya goes to the front, we go to the back after Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Unless we come up with something better over text this week.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, isn't he always going to know where we are?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wonder if the Traveler could--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But that's what faith is, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wonder if the Traveler could put out the volcano so it doesn't erupt if it gets bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But what if the Traveler could shroud us, keep him from being able to see us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's always worth going for the smaller miracle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that seem like a smaller one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is that? What was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, this is me going, given the circumstances, given Traveler Con's arrival.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Given the idea, I was going to give advantage on the roll, so you could-- you don't really have advantage on a percentile die, but we're doing it here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I see that sword hilt when you get a second?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to run Detect Magic over it really quick, just to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it have any kind of runes or anything on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as part of the interring of the body, the blade was destroyed to gift the power of the blade to the spirit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did we take the armor, too?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With that, though, is there-- we know Vokodo is greedy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was definitely going to think about giving it as a gift.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there something any of you magic users can do where you can infuse a trap onto an item or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never done it before, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If that's part of Vilya's offering.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus, you can imbue an item with, like, sunlight, right so?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can imbue an item with a lot of things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can-- what is it, that ward?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, (chuckles). I know what you're talking about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me, are you talking to me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can put a symbol on something that explodes, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I can't remember what level it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you're able to hand off a couple of grenades to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's called Glyph of Warding?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I'm not looking at my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. But at higher levels-- you can cast it at higher levels to do more damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you can set when-- the parameters around which it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So in theory, you could cast it the night before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depending on how many 3rd-level slots you have on multiple items.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If the object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast the spell, the glyph is broken.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you have to be real creative in how you'd move that item.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You put it on an item--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That will be an experiment for another day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pull it up, but then as soon as he grabs it-- does it trigger once it's moved 10 feet or...?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But if you cast the spell, and then were like, for say, seal it amber.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, it's not being moved from where--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If it yanks it, then it's going to explode.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, Vokodo, here we present you (thumping) these fine gifts to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The only question is, is he listening to us right now? But it is a fine idea and worth trying all the same.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, that's why we've been calling him Guacamole this whole time and he definitely doesn't know who we're talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because he has asked questions that, if "he were indeed listening in, he would know the answer."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been scouting for places to have the event.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we've at least found a sword hilt so far to give.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if he senses where we are, then he'll know that we're coming up the back door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't tell you. I don't know."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it might make it worth it to enter the front door now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we just all put a glyph or as many glyphs as we can on items?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It also takes diamond to do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I can powder it if you have it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm a little nervous about powdering diamond.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we don't have a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And at the time for talking, sadly, has definitely passed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It doesn't do, like, a crazy ton of damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I think there are better--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unless you did it at a high level and then that's wasting a...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, depends on if you-- Depends on if you use a bunch-- I mean, depending on how many 3rd-level slots you have the night before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but it takes a 200-- a diamond worth 200 gold each time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about a good case of Fluffernutter? Could we get a nice gilded case or box full of powder with a glyph on it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can paint a really beautiful gilded box.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Upon close inspection he would know, but it would look like something amazing before that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe there's some powder in the boats?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a Fluffernutter and I have a depth charge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just gives us one more, one more weapon in the fight, I suppose?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can work on that when we camp tonight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it wasn't nothing when we used it against the hydra.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, all we have to decide now--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we'll pick up there next week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scratching their heads as they go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got some interesting plots and plans to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Coming up with all the answers on the fly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We love you very much, and is it Thursday yet? Good night!
